pageContext.claim: “So normally, most candidates like, you know, the people that don't know too much -- they'll go and do a -- they'd hire a pollster. The pollster goes to about 92 people. Then they wonder why the polls are wrong. How come the polls were wrong? In my case, they do a poll and then they add 10 or 12 percent now to it. They've learned that. Took them a little while to figure that one out. But you know what? I do it.”
pageContext.analysis: Nonsense. Depending on the methodology and the size of the area being polled, 92 respondents may be sufficient to form valid conclusions. No respectable pollster would add 10 to 12 percentage points -- just because -- to the results.
